channel.title: NEED HELP Getting RSPS 667 Online
channel.description:
- I have port forwarded my router to 43594 and checked with canyouseeme.org and it says it's ok - I have a no-ip which I put in client.java (in the client folder) - i have a jar file which only works on the computer with the server folder, and not any other computer. (I already tried)
Why doesnt it work on the other computer? I tried theClient Jar file on computer 2 and it's stuck at 1%
Please Help with my server

item.title: NEED HELP Getting RSPS 667 Online
item.dc:creator: @carlm3 carlm3
item.description:
@carlm3 wrote:

It Works!!!1

YES!!!

Thanks Guys!!

I had to fix the compiler and compile everything.

But Does anyone know where I can advertise my Awsome RSPS at?

Read full topic

item.title: NEED HELP Getting RSPS 667 Online
item.dc:creator: @grandstinger grandstinger
item.description:
@grandstinger wrote:

[quote=“carlm3, post:8, topic:550187”]Ok

  • I changed Client.Java, Gamestub.Java,and Loader.Java from 127.0.0.1 to my No-IP. is this correct to change all 3?

  • On computer 2 which has the client only, it is stuck at 1% loading, what does this mean?

  • Port Forwardiing is Good and Running the No-IP DUC with 3 green check marks

Note; The game works fine on the computer with the Server folder, but trying to get it online on computer 2.

Could someone test my client out on their computer to see if it works?

Just click on the picture to download[/quote]

from what i know you only need to change the ip in Loader.java.

And you’re sure you compiled?

Read full topic

item.title: NEED HELP Getting RSPS 667 Online
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Make sure the firewall isn’t blocking the connection, and follow what I said here when it comes to the IP address:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:5, topic:550187”]1) You must have the server running before loading the client.
As for connecting to the server… Make sure you follow this guide:

[quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=668888.msg4473230#msg4473230 date=1424303271]
When you are on the same computer as the server - Set the client IP to “localhost” or “127.0.0.1”. They do the same thing.
When you are on the same network as the server - Set the client IP to the local IP address (The one you used to portforward in your router)
When you are on a different network as the server - Set the client IP to either your No-IP (Assuming the No-IP DUC is running) or your IP address (Found at http://whatismyip.com)

No-IP is “old technology” and hardly needs to be used. The reason people used it in the past was because their IP addresses were dynamic, so if they used their normal address it would eventually change, thus rendering the client useless. However, in this day and age, hardly anyone has a dynamic IP (That doesn’t mean there aren’t people who do), so it’s not needed.
[/quote][/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: NEED HELP Getting RSPS 667 Online
item.dc:creator: @carlm3 carlm3
item.description:
@carlm3 wrote:

Yes I have checked port 43594 and it shows it is open

is there something I missed? I put my No-IP in Client.Java, Gamestub.Java,and Loader.Java

What do I have to do to the server to get it to work?

  • I am running the No-IP DUC
  • Server is also Running

Read full topic

item.title: NEED HELP Getting RSPS 667 Online
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Client getting stuck at 1% means it can not connect to the server.

You are also not allowed to post your website link here, so please edit your post and remove it.

Have you checked on http://canyouseeme.org when the server is on that your port is open?

Read full topic

item.title: NEED HELP Getting RSPS 667 Online
item.dc:creator: @carlm3 carlm3
item.description:
@carlm3 wrote:

Ok

  • I changed Client.Java, Gamestub.Java,and Loader.Java from 127.0.0.1 to my No-IP. is this correct to change all 3?

  • On computer 2 which has the client only, it is stuck at 1% loading, what does this mean?

  • Port Forwardiing is Good and Running the No-IP DUC with 3 green check marks

Note; The game works fine on the computer with the Server folder, but trying to get it online on computer 2.

Could someone test my client out on their computer to see if it works?

Just click on the picture to download

item.title: NEED HELP Getting RSPS 667 Online
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You need to compile after making changes.

But no, the server itself binds to your IP address, you do not need to specify one.

Read full topic

item.title: NEED HELP Getting RSPS 667 Online
item.dc:creator: @carlm3 carlm3
item.description:
@carlm3 wrote:

Here’s what I did within my client folder (before I jarred it)

  • I changed both Gamestub.Java and Loader.Java from 127.0.0.1 to my No-IP

-Port-forwarding is Good (Port is open)

is there anything i need to edit in the Server folder to make it work?

Read full topic

item.title: NEED HELP Getting RSPS 667 Online
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

  1. You must have the server running before loading the client.
    As for connecting to the server… Make sure you follow this guide:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:5, topic:550012”]When you are on the same computer as the server - Set the client IP to “localhost” or “127.0.0.1”. They do the same thing.
When you are on the same network as the server - Set the client IP to the local IP address (The one you used to portforward in your router)
When you are on a different network as the server - Set the client IP to either your No-IP (Assuming the No-IP DUC is running) or your IP address (Found at http://whatismyip.com)

No-IP is “old technology” and hardly needs to be used. The reason people used it in the past was because their IP addresses were dynamic, so if they used their normal address it would eventually change, thus rendering the client useless. However, in this day and age, hardly anyone has a dynamic IP (That doesn’t mean there aren’t people who do), so it’s not needed.[/quote]

Read full topic
